com.gembox.spreadsheet

Class HtmlSaveOptions

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.gembox.spreadsheet.SaveOptions
      • com.gembox.spreadsheet.HtmlSaveOptions

  • public final class HtmlSaveOptions
extends SaveOptions
    Represents options for saving to HyperText Markup Language File (HTML) format.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      HtmlSaveOptions()
      Initializes a new instance of the HtmlSaveOptions class.

      Gets the charset for the Html file.
      String getContentType()
      Gets the content-type for HTML file format: message/rfc822 if getHtmlType() is HtmlType.MHTML, otherwise "text/html; charset=" + getCharset().name().

    • Method Detail

      • getCharset

        public Charset getCharset()
        Gets the charset for the Html file.

      • getContentType

        public String getContentType()
        Gets the content-type for HTML file format:
        • message/rfc822 if getHtmlType() is HtmlType.MHTML, otherwise
        • "text/html; charset=" + getCharset().name().
        Specified by:
        getContentType in class SaveOptions
        Returns:
        The content-type for HTML file format.
        See Also:

      • getFilesDirectoryPath

        public String getFilesDirectoryPath()
        Gets the physical directory where ExcelPictures and ExcelWorksheets files will be saved.
        Returns:
        The physical directory where ExcelPictures and ExcelWorksheets files will be saved.

      • getFilesDirectorySrcPath

        public String getFilesDirectorySrcPath()
        Gets the relative directory that will be used when referencing ExcelPictures and ExcelWorksheets files in the HTML.
        Returns:
        The relative directory that will be used when referencing ExcelPictures and ExcelWorksheets files in the HTML.

      • getHtmlType

        public HtmlType getHtmlType()
        Gets the type of export.

        For HtmlType.HTML and HtmlType.HTML_TABLE values, pictures will be exported only if ExcelFile.save(String) or ExcelFile.save(String, SaveOptions) overload is used or if getFilesDirectoryPath() is specified or if isEmbedImages() is set to true.

        For HtmlType.MHTML value, pictures are always exported.

        Returns:
        The HtmlType value for type of export.

      • getLimitations

        public FileFormatLimitations getLimitations()
        Gets limitations for saving to HTML file format.

        These are the limits:

        • MaxRows: Integer.MAX_VALUE
        • MaxColumns: Integer.MAX_VALUE
        • MaxColors: Integer.MAX_VALUE
        • MaxCellStyles: Integer.MAX_VALUE
        Specified by:
        getLimitations in class SaveOptions

      • getSelectionType

        public SelectionType getSelectionType()
        Gets a value indicating whether to save the whole ExcelFile or just active worksheet.

      • isEmbedImages

        public boolean isEmbedImages()
        Gets a value indicating whether images are embedded directly within the HTML file in form of Base64 encoding.

        If the value is true then each image element will contain raw image data in its source attribute. This value doesn't change the pictures export behavior when using HtmlType.MHTML.

      • isWriteCellAddress

        public boolean isWriteCellAddress()
        Gets a value indicating whether each td HTML element should contain data-cell attribute with cell address for this cell.

        If the value is true then each td HTML element will contain data-cell attribute with cell address for this cell (for example data-cell="A1").

      • setCharset

        public void setCharset(Charset charset)
        Sets the charset for the Html file.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - Value is set to null.

      • setEmbedImages

        public void setEmbedImages(boolean embedImages)
        Sets a value indicating whether images are embedded directly within the HTML file in form of Base64 encoding.

        If the value is true then each image element will contain raw image data in its source attribute. This value doesn't change the pictures export behavior when using HtmlType.MHTML.

      • setFilesDirectoryPath

        public void setFilesDirectoryPath(String value)
        Sets the physical directory where ExcelPictures and ExcelWorksheets files will be saved.

        If value is null or empty string and HTML export is called with ExcelFile.save(String) or ExcelFile.save(String, SaveOptions) overload, value will be automatically set to htmlFileNameWithoutExtension + "_files". This directory will be created in the same location as HTML file.

        Parameters:
        value - The physical directory where ExcelPictures and ExcelWorksheets files will be saved.

      • setFilesDirectorySrcPath

        public void setFilesDirectorySrcPath(String path)
        Sets the relative directory that will be used when referencing ExcelPictures and ExcelWorksheets files in the HTML.

        If value is null or empty string and HTML export is called with ExcelFile.save(String) or ExcelFile.save(String, SaveOptions) overload, value will be automatically set to htmlFileNameWithoutExtension + "_files".

        Following code demonstrates how to export Excel file to HTML with specifying location where images will be saved. 

        
HtmlSaveOptions htmlSaveOptions = new HtmlSaveOptions();
htmlSaveOptions.setFilesDirectorySrcPath("Art/Images");
ef.save("Data.html", htmlSaveOptions);
        Parameters:
        path - The relative directory that will be used when referencing ExcelPictures and ExcelWorksheets files in the HTML.

      • setHtmlType

        public void setHtmlType(HtmlType htmlType)
        Sets the type of export.

        For HtmlType.HTML and HtmlType.HTML_TABLE values, pictures will be exported only if ExcelFile.save(String) or ExcelFile.save(String, SaveOptions) overload is used or if getFilesDirectoryPath() is specified or if isEmbedImages() is set to true.

        For HtmlType.MHTML value, pictures are always exported.

        Parameters:
        htmlType - The HtmlType value for type of export.

      • setSelectionType

        public void setSelectionType(SelectionType value)
        Sets a value indicating whether to save the whole ExcelFile or just active worksheet.

      • setWriteCellAddress

        public void setWriteCellAddress(boolean writeCellAddress)
        Sets a value indicating whether each td HTML element should contain data-cell attribute with cell address for this cell.

        If the value is true then each td HTML element will contain data-cell attribute with cell address for this cell (for example data-cell="A1").
